net.avensome.dev.gnupolpot.api.plotter

Interface IPlotter


  • public interface IPlotter

    This interface is used to manipulate the plot displayed in gnupolpot's main window. Points and shapes are managed by ILayer instances. A bunch of methods provided by this interface can be used to browse layer stack, add new layers and remove existing ones. IPlotter also lets you manipulate the viewport.

    Plot contains a stack of independent layers. Points and shapes can belong to one or more layers. Each layer can be removed independently. Points and shapes disappear from plot when they no longer belong to any layer.

    Remember to call requestRepaint() each time you make some changes to layers, like, for example, adding new points.

    • Property Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Type Property and Description
      javafx.beans.property.SimpleObjectProperty<PlotPoint> focusedPoint
      Plot currently under the cursor.

    • Property Detail

      • focusedPoint

        javafx.beans.property.SimpleObjectProperty<PlotPoint> focusedPointProperty
        Plot currently under the cursor.

    • Method Detail

      • isPristine

        boolean isPristine()
        Returns whether plotter is in the pristine state, that is it only has one layer that is empty.
        Returns:
        Whether plotter is pristine.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all existing layers and creates a single, empty layer.

      • getLayers

        java.util.List<ILayer> getLayers()
        Returns:
        Read-only list of all layers, starting with the bottommost one.

      • getActiveLayer

        ILayer getActiveLayer()
        Returns:
        Currently active layer.

      • createLayerOnTop

        ILayer createLayerOnTop(java.lang.String label)
        Creates a new layer on top of layer stack.
        Parameters:
        label - that should be assigned to the newly created layer
        Returns:
        Created layer.

      • createLayerAbove

        ILayer createLayerAbove(ILayer refLayer,
                        java.lang.String label)
        Creates a new layer above any provided layer currently on the layer stack.
        Parameters:
        refLayer - reference layer; new one will be created above it
        label - that should be assigned to the newly created layer
        Returns:
        Created layer.

      • createLayerUnder

        ILayer createLayerUnder(ILayer refLayer,
                        java.lang.String label)
        Creates a new layer below any provided layer currently on the layer stack.
        Parameters:
        refLayer - reference layer; new one will be created below it
        label - that should be assigned to the newly created layer
        Returns:
        Created layer.

      • deleteLayer

        void deleteLayer(ILayer layer)
        Removes layer from the layer stack.
        Parameters:
        layer - that should be deleted

      • selectActiveLayer

        void selectActiveLayer(ILayer layer)
        Activates layer. Active layer is returned by getActiveLayer() and is affected by Layer pane buttons.
        Parameters:
        layer - to be activated

      • moveLayer

        void moveLayer(ILayer layer,
               IPlotter.LayerMove move)
        throws LayerException
        Moves layer up or down the layer stack one layer at a time or to the top/bottom instantly.
        Parameters:
        layer - a layer currently on the layer stack that you want to move
        move - how to move the layer
        Throws:
        LayerException - When moving layer is impossible. For example if you try to move the topmost layer up.

      • duplicateLayer

        void duplicateLayer(ILayer layer)
        Duplicates provided layer and all points and shapes that it contains, then adds it over current active layer.
        Parameters:
        layer - to be duplicated

      • mergeLayers

        void mergeLayers(ILayer mergeInto,
                 ILayer... toBeMerged)
        Merges one or more layers into a master layer. Master layer is the only one of provided ones that remains on the stack after this method completes. Master layer contains all points and shapes that belonged to any of passed layers. Other layers are removed from the layer stack.
        Parameters:
        mergeInto - master layer that points and shapes will be appended to
        toBeMerged - layers to be merged into master layer

      • getViewport

        IViewport getViewport()
        Returns:
        Viewport object that can be used to manipulate plotter's viewport.

      • zoomAll

        void zoomAll()
        Modify viewport to make entire plot visible at once and as big as possible, then center plot.

      • requestRepaint

        void requestRepaint()

        Queue plot repaint. This method must be called each time layer contents change. This includes repositioning points, adding shapes, changing colors etc. If your plot doesn't update update unless you pan it, then you forgot to call this method.

        Calling this method multiple times in a row should be safe. It doesn't repaint plot immediately, it queues a repaint in a near future.

      • getSnapshot

        javafx.scene.image.WritableImage getSnapshot()
        Returns:
        An image of currently visible plot part.

      • setCursor

        void setCursor(javafx.scene.Cursor cursor)
        Sets mouse cursor image when the pointer is over the plot area.
        Parameters:
        cursor - that will be set

      • focusedPointProperty

        javafx.beans.property.SimpleObjectProperty<PlotPoint> focusedPointProperty()
        Plot currently under the cursor.
